attributes.action: Stop all serving politicians from being included in any Honours lists
attributes.background: Time and time again who ever is in government are seen to be rewarding loyal members of their party even if they aren't doing a good job. Being Knighted for sitting on a committee or being a loyal party member isn't good enough and is making a joke of the whole system.

attributes.action: Pets in pet shops need to be in bigger and better tanks/cages. It’s just cruel.
attributes.background: Everyday you see rodents, such as hamsters, cavies, rabbits just stuck in tiny glass cages with little to no movement...and it is awful. I’d really like the legal cage requirements to be doubled as it breaks my heart seeing them in that condition

attributes.action: Take pitbulls out of the Dangerous Dogs Act
attributes.background: Pitbulls are not dangerous dogs. They are called nanny dogs, they look after their family.  They get blamed for all sorts of bad press. If people treated them with respect like any other dog they would know how loving they are.
attributes.additional_details:
Pitbulls look after their families and they are very loving like any other dog you can see.

They have been more bites off small dogs than a large one

attributes.action: Add red hair colour to the protected characteristics of the Equality Act.
attributes.background: Stop cruel comments with insinuations that being a red head is unfortunate ugly and embarrassing.That a person deserves to be bullied because there a red head.
attributes.additional_details: Taunting red heads seems to be the last socially accepted freebie in society, yet it's impact can be as devastating to the receiver as any person covered in the discrimination act. Abuse ranges from name calling which leads to low self esteem and depression. Most disturbing suicide. Serious assaults have occurred just for being a red head. A red head can't change the colour of hair. Like a person can't change their skin colour, sexual orientation or disability.  It can't continue. It's not "OK".

attributes.action: Cut Foreign Aid to £2B and use the balance for UK Defence and Public Services.
attributes.background: The Foreign Aid budget of  0.7% of GDP is an arbitrary target which sees the UK actually borrow money to then give it away to foreign countries. At a time of such worldwide insecurity, this money would be much better spent on the UK's Armed Forces and on helping the NHS & other Public Services.

attributes.action: Make prostitution legal in order to make sex workers safe and keep them healthy.
attributes.background: For our citizenship GCSE qualification, we must choose an issue that we believe needs attention, and should be discussed as many people are being affected by the stigma on sex workers.This affects their health and safety as they are scared to be tested for STIs or report cases such as rape or abuse.
attributes.additional_details: Before creating this petition, we did research on both the advantages and disadvantages of legalizing prostitution and how it would affect people. We also conducted primary research and gave out a questionnaire in school asking teachers their opinion on the issue and explaining how people, especially sex workers, would benefit if it were legal. 61% of the teachers agreed that it should be legalized before we told them the advantages and disadvantages, and 75% agreed after learning the benefits.

attributes.action: Improve safety and quality of our road network and reduce congestion
attributes.background: 1.Starting in driving schools by ensuring there is more attention on teaching safe driving on motorways and dual carriage ways. We think that driving on these types of roads requires techniques that are not well emphasised by current training methods.
attributes.additional_details:
Improvement could be achieved if new drivers would be taught of correct speed selection, acceleration and keeping left when not overtaking. 
2.Improving existing roads by installing more signs to remind drivers of simple rules such as:
-Keep left when not overtaking (middle lane hogging)
-Keep your distance

attributes.action: Provide victims of the most severe sexual crimes anonymity throughout trial.
attributes.background: Currently victims of crimes under the Sexual Offences (Amendment) Act 1992 are given lifetime anonymity from the media. Despite attempts to fully provide protection during trial details of the victims name are made available to the accused; even in cases of serious sexual assault by a stranger.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition calls for other means of identifying victims such as pseudonym, case number or photo to be considered.
 
Sexual assaults are crimes of power and control, a name is a key part of personal identity so giving the accused the victim’s name adds to the assault. Much of what you do or are is linked to your name, having it makes it easy to identify, locate or contact someone.
 
Using a victim’s name within courts would seem to contravene Article 8 of the Human Rights Act.

attributes.action: Only allow fireworks on Firework night and New Years Eve due to pets rights.
attributes.background: I believe it is wrong that fireworks are released for days before and days after both Fireworks night and New Years Eve. This can scare pets and cause them to be unable to move from a position or relieve themselves outside. This is against their rights under the five freedoms, so should be illegal.
attributes.additional_details: This can also cause animals to run away from owners, or bolt when on walks, and so can leave owners devastated, and can lead to deaths and injuries to these animals. This can cause both emotional, physical and financial damage to the owners and public, along with emotional and physical damage to pets.

attributes.action: Require labelling of all products which contain pig or its bye products
attributes.background: Lot of products edible or for human use are in the market which contain pig and its bye products without specifying. Jellies, soaps, breads and spreads etc. can contain lard or pig bones without specifying. This hurts lots of people’s sentiments and beliefs.

attributes.action: Make school food-growing (and self-sufficiency) part of the National Curriculum.
attributes.background: All schools have space for growing food & with innovative techniques such as vertical gardening, even edges of a playground can become an allotment. Invest in schools so that they can REDUCE external dependency. Off-grid futures would incl. energy generation, rain-water harvesting & recycling.
attributes.additional_details:
The larger the space available, the larger the impact on education, health & school finances. It's also time to consider deleting meat from school meals, instead invest in growing fruit & veg (broccoli has more protein/calorie than beef).

Growing minds, building healthy futures, teaching valuable life-skills, helping children embrace the outdoors - growing food at school & learning about sustainability is fun, engaging & unforgettable, an essential subject for the National Curriculum.

attributes.action: Make bullying a criminal offence
attributes.background: Bullying can drive people to have mental health problems, to self-harm and even to suicide because we are all human.
attributes.additional_details: If someone is reported for bullying, they should have a police warning. If they continue should be arrested and imprisoned for 24hrs. If they still continue then they should do community service. We need to crack down on bullying on all levels.

attributes.action: Encourage schools to expell students who are bullying others.
attributes.background: All across the world, students are bullied in school. However, this is increasing dramatically. Head teachers should be encouraged to expel students who are bullying other students, as the victims often do not feel safe while the bullies are around.
attributes.additional_details: Young people/students have enough school related stress to deal with such as exams and coursework. Being bullied can affect their grades, their self esteem and in a lot of cases, their lives. Schools should be encouraged to expel individuals who bully others, out of respect for the victims. Many young people do not feel safe in school due to bullying, and this must stop altogether.

attributes.action: Amend the Gender Recognition Act 2004 to remove the need for a medical diagnosis
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, urge the government of the United Kingdom of Great Britain to remove any requirement for a diagnosis of gender dysphoria (as endorsed by a psychiatrist or medical practitioner) to receive a gender recognition certificate under the Gender Recognition Act of 2004.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently, the GRA04 requires a psychiatrist or medical practitioner to diagnose someone with gender dysphoria in order to gain a gender recognition certificate. This is wrong because:

1) Not all transgender people experience dysphoia.
2) There are often considerable waits to see a psychologist or medical practitioner about gender issues, and so this delays the whole process.
3) Seeing someone about gender issues is often invasive, or otherwise uncomfortable.

attributes.action: Post on Motorway message boards to remind middle lane 'Hoggers' to Pull Over
attributes.background:
Every driver has experienced being in a long tail back as one lorry slowly edges past another. 

Drivers can now be given 3 points for not pulling back into the Left-hand lane but this is not enforced. 

Why not use the Electronic signs to remind drivers to use the left to improve traffic flow?

attributes.action: Make all ESA & PIP assessment centres fully accessible.
attributes.background: Too many people are arriving for a DWP disability assessment to discover they cannot get into the building due to steps, stairs or staff only lifts. Many of these people are being told they should have informed the assessment providers they required wheelchair access beforehand. This has to stop.

attributes.action: Investigate the links between MPs and foreign intelligence services
attributes.background: In our age of democracy it is important that all our representatives in Parliament do not act in a way that can be seen to be against parliamentary and democratic standards.

attributes.action: Lower Prescription charges
attributes.background: People already pay taxes which goes to medicine which technically means that everyone is paying twice. This means we pay to make or buy them from other places, then we pay again to get them from a pharmacy which is ridiculous.
attributes.additional_details: Some people get prescription that doesn’t work, but they still have to pay for a new prescription. This is not fair as you cannot get a refund and the prescription did not do what it was made to do.

attributes.action: Move the Palace of Westminster to new purpose-built Parliament in Birmingham
attributes.background: The existing Palace of Westminster is no longer 'fit for purpose'.  The adversarial debating chamber is archaic and the infrastructure needs total upgrading.  The proposed cost for refurbishment could be spent on a new building in Birmingham, the centre of Britain.
attributes.additional_details:
It's time Parliament dragged itself into the 21st century.  By relocating to Birmingham in the centre of Britain, government can truly represent all the people and not just the elite, privileged few.  
Estimated costs to refurbish the existing Palace of Westminster are unacceptable:
https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2018/jan/28/mps-to-vote-on-vacating-parliament-building-in-need-of-refurbishment
A modern debating chamber is essential for fair government.

attributes.action: Campaign for a Festival of Britain 2021 to celebrate 70 years since last one
attributes.background: UK has faced years of austerity - likely to continue up to 2021. This would give the British people a feel-good factor and added  prestige throughout the world, which will promote tourism.  An opportunity for trade and industry visits from other nations to showcase the UK as open for business
attributes.additional_details: Refer to the previous Festival of Britain in 1951 and look at what events occurred from those days and consider an updated version which included London and other provincial cities.   Put into place exhibitions, the provision of a festival ship (which occurred previously to promote British ports and industry).  Ask other major cities to put on events that may be a speciality to that particular region (eg historical interests and future innovations).

attributes.action: Scrap the Severn bridge tolls sooner than December 2018.
attributes.background: The Severn bridge tolls are due to be scrapped in December 2018, with a reduction in January 2018. The bridge has paid for itself several times over but the UK government refuse to abolish the tolls sooner, this is having a detrimental effect on the welsh economy, welsh business and commuters.

attributes.action: Ban log burning stoves that pollute the air
attributes.background: Myself and my disabled husband cannot use our garden nor go out our door without smoke and smell on our clothes and air. Smoke and smell come into the house if we open a window or door.
attributes.additional_details: Have reported this to fire services, who saw it and gave us masks to wear to get to church. Carers have witnessed the debris and smoke. Environmental health officer saw it and debris and did nothing but said he should have collected the debris.

attributes.action: Establish a Public Service Production Company thats funded by the British public
attributes.background: Our film industry is currently a subsidiary of the US film industry. US Film Companies are incentivised by the Government to produce their films in the UK through tax rebates and breaks Instead of financially supporting the US industry the Government needs to financially support it's own
attributes.additional_details:
The petitions asks for the establishment of a publicly owned and funded film production company that produces films which serve a public interest. 

References http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-28213379 http://ask.ofcom.org.uk/help/television/what_is_psb http://www.newstatesman.com/culture/2015/03/we-dont-have-british-film-industry-business-film-takes-us-behind-movie-scenes

attributes.action: Make it illegal for ticket resales to be more than 10% of Face Value
attributes.background: Today, May 1st 2018, we waited patiently to buy one of 90,000 tickets available for a London NFL game on Ticketmaster. Within the space of five minutes, they were sold out and available on other sites such as Viagogo for more than four times their face value.
attributes.additional_details: For example, we have paid £170 each for tickets which, through Ticketmaster, should have cost us £41 each. This is not just making a profit, this is theft. It is taking advantage of people who are desperate to see their idols, to experience something for the first time ever, who have worked exceptionally hard towards.

attributes.action: Recognise autism assistance dogs as an Assistance Service Dog like guide dogs.
attributes.background: Everywhere you go you see no dogs allowed except guide dogs. Obviously guide dogs help people see but for a child or adult who has additional needs or autism this helps them be more safe secure and make them more comfortable in surroundings they wouldn’t usually be comfortable in.
attributes.additional_details:
They have little sense of danger. 1 in 100 children in the UK are diagnosed with Autism. Half of these children will have a tendency to bolt and wander off, which can be very dangerous, and has often resulted in injuries to the child. 

Autism Assistance Dogs are trained to provide safety and companionship, helping to bring independence and a more socially inclusive Promote positive changes in behaviour Provide comfort for children when upset Reduce behavioural outbursts.

attributes.action: Abolish the Palace of Westminster restaurant subsidy for those earning over £23K
attributes.background: In 2016, the food/drink subsidy in Parliament cost around £3.7M. This use of taxpayers’ money must stop for higher earners, with funds diverted to public services where it is needed. Citizens who themselves struggle to buy food should not be forced to help feed MPs who earn significant wages.

attributes.action: The emergency SMS number 112 should be advertised on TV by the government.
attributes.background: The emergency SMS number 112 is a very useful alternative emergency services number to 999.  It is a number that also works across Europe and most countries worldwide. In training sessions for Basic Life Support it is clear that most people have never hear of its key properties.
attributes.additional_details: The properties of the emergency number 112 needs to be advertised by the UK government in a television information campaign on BBC. The advantages of 112 are that it is a GPS service.  People who are trying to contact emergency services do not need to know where they are as the 112 service can pin point their location.  Also, people can register their phone number to text an emergency message to 112.  This is crucial in areas where a phone signal is not possible.  The text will get through.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of pencil sharpeners with easy release blades.
attributes.background: Many young adults these days with the pressures of school, friends and social media struggle at times and sadly turn to self-harm. As a parent you can hide all the sharp cutting items in your house only to find your child using the removable blade from a pencil sharpener.
attributes.additional_details: How is that an under 18 can’t go and buy a knife, razor or anything with a blade but can go and buy a pencil sharpener which has a removable blade? There’s even a video on YouTube that shows you how to remove it although it is only a tiny screw holding it in so it’s not rocket science! To ban all under 18s buying one is not perceivable but I do believe they could be manufactured differently such as having a non-tamper screw. If the Government bans those where the blade is easy to release, industry will follow with a safer product. Something has to be done.

attributes.action: Allow supply teachers to pay into the 'Teachers' Pension'.
attributes.background: Supply teachers cannot pay into the Teachers' Pension. If you are contracted for 2 hours a week you can opt-in, but as a supply teacher working 5 days a week you can't. Why? Because supply agencies don't employ us, so can't pay the employer's contribution. The ethics of agencies are another debate.
attributes.additional_details: Supply teachers used to be employed by LEAs. They were paid to scale, had pay progression and a pension. Successive governments have turned a blind eye to agencies taking this role where supply teachers are not paid to scale, have no pay progression and have no pension. A supply teacher will earn £16000 a year if they work every school day (the agencies having got £29,250 for that teacher). Some things we have to accept: the government signing our pension away, we shouldn't have to.

attributes.action: Clearing pavements of ice should not bring legal liability if someone then falls
attributes.background: The law is such that persons clearing public pavements of snow and ice, e.g. outside their house or business, are then liable for civil action in the event someone slips, whereas not clearing the ice means you are not responsible, and thus can't be sued. The result is more dangerous pavements.
attributes.additional_details:
While the principle of "liability where actions have been taken" is sound, in this case it results in a less beneficial outcome. 
Government advice is "you're unlikely to be sued", but that is hardly encouraging. https://www.gov.uk/clear-snow-road-path-cycleway

There will always be a grey area where the use of inappropriate methods (like warm water) should be admissible when determining blame, but in the absence of such proof, the intent to clear ice in itself should not bring liability.

attributes.action: Stop Government bTB tests being a death sentence on healthy animals.
attributes.background: Alpaca owners want the Government to work with them to eradicate bovine tuberculosis(btb). Testing rules are draconian and need to be reviewed. Please support a testing regime that does not condemn a healthy alpaca to death by always allowing a retest where no substantial evidence for disease exits.
attributes.additional_details:
At the moment less than 7% of alpacas have been tested and the industry wants that to be at least 80%. 

bTB test results are not being shared by APHA or collated and thus no opportunity exists to improve the current situation. Animals are unnecessarily culled before the data is captured. The situation will never improve unless we all work together to learn more about these unique animals for the benefit of all livestock keepers in the UK.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to ask for someone’s previous salary.
attributes.background:
The salary negotiation process, and specifically the gender salary gap is directly affected by a company knowing a person’s previous salary. 

The salary band for the role should be defined for the role, and based on the responsibility and scope.

This shouldn’t be based on the previous salary.
attributes.additional_details: Previous salary should be treated like date of birth or age, gender, disability or trade union membership.

attributes.action: Revise the current council tax system which is not fit for purpose.
attributes.background: Currently properties are assigned a council tax band (A – H) according to their market value in April 1991. Band A properties under £40k whilst Band H over £320k. Despite houses prices rising considerably and disproportionately in some areas, the banding system has remained unchanged for 27 years.
attributes.additional_details:
There are insufficient bands to reflect the current value of properties and charges.  In 2017 the council tax for Band H properties worth millions in Westminster and Kensington and Chelsea was £1376 and £2124 respectively, whilst in East Sussex it was £3500 for houses worth a fraction of the price.  The system is unfair and advantages those with high value properties

One solution is increase the number of bands to reflect the current variation in house values and make the system more equitable.

attributes.action: Pass a law requiring cattle allowed to graze grass outside min. 8 hours per day
attributes.background: Many dairy cattle are kept in sheds for up to 24 hours a day, in some cases all year. They're fed diets which aren't healthy or natural for them. As a result of this, over-milking and preventing movement they typically become ill and are killed at 3 to 5 years old. Their natural lifespan is 20 years
attributes.additional_details:
Scientific studies & other information
https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/17033013
https://stud.epsilon.slu.se/5285/1/kivling_s_130215.pdf
https://www.ciwf.org.uk/farm-animals/cows/dairy-cows
https://www.ciwf.org.uk/media/5235185/the-life-of-dairy-cows.pdf
http://www.research.ed.ac.uk/portal/en/publications/housing-system-milk-production-and-zerograzing-effects-on-lameness-and-leg-injury-in-dairy-cows(117d66b0-cd77-4c79-82f6-d15053cd02fb).html

attributes.action: Restore Nursing bursaries
attributes.background:
The shortage of nursing staff is adversely affecting patient care 
Scrapping nursing bursaries has affected the recruitment of nurses
Nursing is one of the most valuable professions , and should be supported in every way possible

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for all cyclists to wear reflective jackets in the dark.
attributes.background: I frequently drive in the dark during the Autumn/Winter months and have noticed how frequently I pass cyclists that are not wearing anything reflective. To ensure the safety of cyclists and of drivers, I feel that it should be compulsory for them to wear a reflective jacket in the dark.
attributes.additional_details: Most of the cyclists I pass in the Autumn/Winter months wear dark clothing and rely on a small bicycle light to make them noticeable to drivers. It is not safe and it is not helpful. I feel that these cyclists are putting their own lives at risk by not wearing reflective clothing and by not doing so, also putting drivers at risk. I feel quite strongly about this, mostly because the reflective jackets are not expensive, so there is no excuse not to wear one.

attributes.action: Debate the relevance of the Right to Buy legislation
attributes.background: Because of the increasing number of homeless families/single people, this request asks that Parliament debates the relevancy of the Right to Buy legislation, considering whether by revoking it thereby leaving more homes under Council control the numbers of homeless might decrease.
attributes.additional_details: I recently saw a discussion on the television where the particular Council responding to a question concerning their inability to house homeless families/single people said that for every three properties they built, two others of their stock went for 'right to buy'. I know little of the problems of Councils housing people nor of the Right to Buy Legislation but it seems to me possible that those that introduced the legislation may not have anticipated todays number of homeless.

attributes.action: Provide increase support for parents with disabilities and their children
attributes.background: Children who have parents with disabilities are only able to access free school meals, the nursery grant for 2 year olds and pupil premium if they are on income related benefits. This means many working parents with a disabled partner are left better off leaving work to care for their families.
attributes.additional_details: Where a parent is on PIP they are considered “incapacitated” for childcare purposes in tax credit legislation and for extended hours nursery provision for 3 year olds. This does not extend to pupil premium, 2 year old nursery places or to free school meals - even if the incapacitated parent is unable to prepare a meal for themselves. Where one parent works and the other is considered incapacitated, children should receive these in order for the working parent to remain in work.

attributes.action: Ban anti bird spikes from being installed on trees and other natural roosts.
attributes.background:
Residents in a wealthy area of Bristol have installed the spikes on the roosting branches of some trees to protect their cars from bird poo.
UK Bird populations are in great decline. Heinous practices like this is wrong on so many levels.
attributes.additional_details:
It was with great outrage and disgust that I saw this post on Twitter and Had to petition against this practice. 

Photo via @BenjaminRamm

https://mobile.twitter.com/i/moments/943141137761619968?t=1&cn=ZmxleGlibGVfcmVjcw%3D%3D&refsrc=email&iid=41c3015d379349e686e892f1d1521bd3&uid=2754606344&nid=244+273027072

attributes.action: Pressure video sharing sites to remove violent/graphic videos targeted at kids
attributes.background: The online safety of our kids is not being taken seriously by video sharing sites like YouTube. There are hundreds maybe thousands of videos being masked as our children's favourite cartoons. More needs to be done to remove this content before it is published!

attributes.action: Make it a requirement for all new vehicles to be fitted with a tracking device
attributes.background: Car theft is rising in the UK with the vast majority being uninvestigsted by the police either though budget cuts or lack of evidence. This is why all new vehicles sold in the UK should be factory fitted with a tracking device. This will make car theft a thing of the past.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.easier.com/93725-stolen-cars-fitted-tracker-recovered.html

http://eb-iaati.org/news/entry/uk_chance_of_getting_your_stolen_car_back_drops_to_less_than_50_per_cent

attributes.action: Place Mindfulness in to the UK school Curriculum
attributes.background: As a family fitness business we see the importance in health and well-being and we see a huge gap in a healthy mentality amongst children and adults too. We believe that by placing an extra subject in to the uk school curriculum this would benefit the future generations massively.
attributes.additional_details: Good health comes from a healthy fitness level, healthy diet and a healthy mindset. A lot of thought and action has gone in to improving school children’s outlook on sport and fitness, as well as nutrition but the mentality of this young generation is still pretty untouched.

attributes.action: Male & Female employees should be treated the same when on shared parental leave
attributes.background:
Because of the Equality Act 2010 woman and men should have the same company benefits as equal pay.
At the moment companies can offer a enhanced maternity pay that benefits only women can opt not to offer the same benefits to male employees wanting to take Shared Paternal Leave.
attributes.additional_details:
At the moment there isn't any legal requirement, with some cases people making a claim that they are being treated less favourable than women on the same company and/or job, some being successful and some not.
Some companies use the technicality that male employee on shared parental leave is treated no less favourably than a female employee on shared parental leave while they offer enhaced maternity pay a benefit only available to womans.

attributes.action: Launch a National Consultation on Reducing Plastic Usage
attributes.background: Blue Planet 2 has started a national talk on reducing plastic usage, we need to start reducing the hidden plastics in retailers, e.g. Plastic cutlery, wrapping around magazines, DVDs, CDs, Cigarettes etc. A national consultation is needed with companies to reduce the usage of plastics.

attributes.action: Legislate to give wheelchair users priority access to bus wheelchair spaces
attributes.background:
Wheelchair users do not have lawful priority over other passengers for access to designated wheelchair spaces/bays on public buses.

There have been frequent and media reported cases of such persons being able to travel as other passengers refused to move. Legislation is required to address this.
attributes.additional_details:
Unlike passenger railway systems, persons in wheelchairs do not have priority access to wheelchair spaces provided on buses, despite this being the only safe space for a person in a wheelchair to travel.

Despite the recent Supreme Court case brought by Doug Paulley, bus drivers have no legal power to force other passengers to move, and can still only request that they do so.

This is detrimental to any person in a wheelchair and has a significant impact on travel.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to impregnate dairy cows sooner than 2 years after giving birth
attributes.background: Dairy cattle are typically artificially inseminated every year to keep them pregnant or lactating. This, poor diet, selective breeding for milk yield, and preventing them moving, contribute to diseases and them being killed at usually 2 to 5 years old. Cows' natural lifespan is around 20 years.
attributes.additional_details: Scientific studies & other information https://www.ciwf.org.uk/farm-animals/cows/dairy-cows/ https://www.ciwf.org.uk/media/5235188/Welfare-sheet-Dairy-cows.pdf https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/16958626 https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC2851724/

attributes.action: Create an age limit and a license for all dog owners
attributes.background: Hoping to change the law so that anyone who wants to own a dog has to be 21 plus and also have to buy a license for dogs deemed 'bad breeds' such as bull mastiffs, bull dogs, staffies to stop idiotic people from having 'easy' access to these dogs.
attributes.additional_details: In may 2017 a family pet was mauled by 3 big dogs, described as bull mastiff, pit bull and staffordshire bull terrier dogs, the family pet was a king charles cavalier which stood no chance against these 3 massive dogs, but somehow the dog survived. The owner of the dogs is a young lad who has been training them to rip apart cats and lets them run loose when going for walks. 28th Jan 2018 they attacked a Labrador and killed it, again the owner just walked off with the dogs.

attributes.action: Abolish workplace parking charges for NHS staff
attributes.background: These people dedicate their lives to helping the sick and vulnerable and are often poorly paid . It seems extremely unfair that they should be charged for attending work.

attributes.action: We would like the livestock act 1953 to be amended to include alpaca and llama.
attributes.background: Our Alpaca boys were attacked by two lurchers, leaving them traumatised & having to re-home. No prosecution was possible as  the dogs do not fall under the Dangerous Dogs Act 1991, and llamas and alpacas are not protected by the Dogs (Protection of Livestock) Act 1953.
attributes.additional_details: We think this act should be amended to protect these animals.

attributes.action: Assault on emergency service workers   must  carry a term of imprisonment!
attributes.background: Assaults on emergency service workers, i.e. police, fire personnel, paramedic and nurses are too frequently dealt with by caution or suspended sentences. Suspects must be prosecuted and. if convicted, receive an immediate custodial sentence of at least 6 months.
